subject: Re: what difference are there between testRunStarted and testStarted?
msgSnippet: ... testRunStarted() - Called before any tests have been run. testStarted() - Called when an atomic test is about to be started. testRunEndedand() and
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "zengcaihui198627"
<zengcaihui198627@...> wrote:
>
>
> what difference are there between testRunStarted and testStarted?
> And,what difference are there between testRunEndedand testEnded?
>
testRunStarted() - Called before any tests have been run.
testStarted() - Called when an atomic test is about to be started.
testRunEndedand() and testEnded() are similar.


For example, if you want to test class A, than
public class A {

@Test
public void testFirst(){}

@Test
public void testSecond(){}
}

testRunStarted() will be run once before any test method will be
invoked. Afterwards, moment before testFirst() will be invoked
testStarted() will be invoked, afterwards testFirst() will be invoked
and afterwards testEnded(). Afterwards, moment before testSecond()
will be invoked testStarted() will be invoked, afterwards testSecond()
will be invoked and afterwards testEnded(). Finally, testRunEndedand()
will be invoked.
